meanings.definition: To defeat or overcome in power or strength.
meanings.sent1: The superhero outpowered the villain in the final battle.
meanings.sent2: The team outpowered their opponents to win the championship.
meanings.sent3: The tiny mouse outpowered the big cat in a game of wits.
meanings.sent4: The sun outpowered the clouds, shining brightly in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The roaring lion outpowered all other animals in the jungle.

meanings.definition: To be more powerful than someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The new engine design outpowered the old one, making the car faster.
meanings.sent2: The dragon outpowered all other creatures in the mythical land.
meanings.sent3: The toddler outpowered the adults in a playful arm-wrestling match.
meanings.sent4: The storm outpowered the wind, causing chaos in the town.
meanings.sent5: The giant robot outpowered any opponent that dared to challenge it.
